result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J. REED

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dimiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 271, 16 CF 45, 14 CF 442, 15 CF 444, 15 CF 480 and 15 CF 608.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
From atty. Falk requesting new date be set for settlement conference and/or plea date.
It is ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied for the reasons stated on the record on 08-20-15.

Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 09-28-15 at 4:00 p.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defense requests that the no contact condition with Danielle Koch be lifted.  State objects.
Court would extend a motion to allow contact strictly for doctor's appointments or counseling at a later date, but denies the motion at this time.
State to draft order.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-2-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

At 2:34 p.m., $100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy flied.
Minutes.
